title: Not working `hardhat` command as expected when using yarn workspace.
body:
I have found that `hardhat` command is not working with yarn workspace.
(But no problem when using npm workspace.)

I don't think it's a serious problem because hardhat mainly depends npm.
But I'm reporting it just in case👍

The reproduction procedure is as follows. Base hardhat project is created by `npx hardhat` wizard.

Sorry my English is not good enough🙏

### `yarn` case 

```sh
% git clone https://github.com/wbydo/hardhat-issune-report.git
% cd hardhat-issune-report
% git checkout yarn
% yarn install --immutable
% yarn test
```

results

```
% yarn test
yarn run v1.22.15
$ yarn workspace sample-hardhat-project test
warning package.json: No license field
$ hardhat test
Error HH14: Your Hardhat project uses typescript, but it's not installed.
      
Please run: npm install --save-dev typescript

For more info go to https://hardhat.org/HH14 or run Hardhat with --show-stack-traces
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
error Command failed.
Exit code: 1
Command: /Users/wd/.asdf/installs/nodejs/16.13.0/bin/node
Arguments: /Users/wd/.node/corepack/yarn/1.22.15/lib/cli.js test
Directory: /Users/wd/src/github.com/wbydo/hardhat-issune-report/packages/sample-hardhat-project
Output:

info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/workspace for documentation about this command.
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
```

other information

```sh
% yarn -v
1.22.15

% node -v
v16.13.0
```

### `npm` case (expected)

procedure

```sh
% git clone https://github.com/wbydo/hardhat-issune-report.git
% cd hardhat-issune-report
% git checkout npm
% npm ci
% npm test
```

results

``` sh
% npm test

> hardhat-issune-report@0.0.1 test
> npm run -w sample-hardhat-project test


> sample-hardhat-project@0.0.1 test
> hardhat test



  Lock
    Deployment
      ✔ Should set the right unlockTime (598ms)
      ✔ Should set the right owner
      ✔ Should receive and store the funds to lock
      ✔ Should fail if the unlockTime is not in the future
    Withdrawals
      Validations
        ✔ Should revert with the right error if called too soon
        ✔ Should revert with the right error if called from another account
        ✔ Shouldn't fail if the unlockTime has arrived and the owner calls it
      Events
        ✔ Should emit an event on withdrawals
      Transfers
        ✔ Should transfer the funds to the owner


  9 passing (759ms)
```

other information

```sh
% npm -v
7.20.1

% node -v
v16.13.0
```

sample repo link: https://github.com/wbydo/hardhat-issune-report

This issue is also being [tracked on Linear](https://linear.app/nomic-foundation/issue/HH-970/not-working-hardhat-command-as-expected-when-using-yarn-workspace).

We use Linear to manage our development process, but we keep the conversations on Github.

LINEAR-ID: 20ceed43-f785-498f-a450-01fe829de1b8

@wbydo I think the problem is that you are missing all the toolbox's peer dependencies. These are installed automatically when you use npm 7 or later, but they aren't if you are using yarn or an older version of npm.

When you initialize a hardhat project, you should get a prompt asking you if you want to install these, and it shows you the command to do it manually if you answer negatively. (Except on Windows, I think in that case you always get just the command to run) Maybe you forgot to run it? In any case, here it is:

```
  yarn add --dev @nomicfoundation/hardhat-network-helpers @nomicfoundation/hardhat-chai-matchers @nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers @nomiclabs/hardhat-etherscan chai ethers hardhat-gas-reporter solidity-coverage @typechain/hardhat typechain @typechain/ethers-v5 @ethersproject/abi @ethersproject/providers @types/chai @types/mocha @types/node ts-node typescript
```

I did that in the repo you shared and then everything worked fine.

Tentatively closing this, but let me know if you still think there's a problem on our side.
